Chat Summary: During the last storm, the river pushed water up through the yard drains. Can flood panels help if the water’s coming from the river side?
My house was built in the 50s with uneven concrete around the garage. Can barriers still fit properly on these old slabs?
My garage floods even from mild rain because the street slopes toward it. Would a raised threshold help or would that block my car?
The house next door had its foundation lift during Ian. Can barriers increase that kind of pressure on old foundations?
The old sump in my crawl space is unreliable. Is there a new pump system made for these older Fort Myers homes?
Water sneaks under my front door every storm, even with weatherstripping. What seal material actually holds up to our humidity?
My yard slopes toward the house. Would barriers around the entire perimeter make sense or is that overkill?
Tree roots lifted part of my driveway and now the panel won’t sit flat. How do installers deal with that?
My insurer said my barriers voided coverage because they weren’t “engineered.” What does that actually mean?
The city says my house is in a “historic corridor.” Are there any visual restrictions on floodproofing here?
The garage drain spews water up when the river rises. Should I cap it or install a backflow valve?
My storage room under the stairs floods after long rains. Would barriers help if water’s coming through the wall itself?
I’ve noticed mildew behind the baseboards even after minor floods. Can barriers trap that humidity?
I’m tired of power cuts ruining the sump cycle. What’s the most dependable backup power source for pumps here?
I can’t afford a full system right now. Is it possible to install panels just for the garage and front door first?
The last owner never cleaned the weep holes. Can clogged holes cause panel failure?
My cat loves sitting near the lanai door during storms. Are there barriers that don’t trap animals inside accidentally?
I barely sleep when storms are coming because of past floods. What’s the most reliable system to finally relax about it?
Our neighbor’s runoff goes right into our yard. Can barriers redirect it without flooding their place instead?
Are there any environmentally safe flood barriers that won’t leave metal stains or residue on old concrete?
